commented_code:
- name: Test
       shell: bash
-      run: build/reldebug/test/unittest --force-reload --force-storage
+      run: build/reldebug/test/unittest --force-reload --force-storage --summarize-failures

discussion_comments.commented_code:
@@ -193,7 +193,7 @@ jobs:
 
     - name: Test
       shell: bash
-      run: build/reldebug/test/unittest --force-reload --force-storage
+      run: build/reldebug/test/unittest --force-reload --force-storage --summarize-failures
discussion_comments.comment_body: Instead of making this a command line option maybe we can make it an environment variable? That way this also works with the CI runs that run e.g. `make allunit`.

discussion_comments.commented_code:
@@ -193,7 +193,7 @@ jobs:
 
     - name: Test
       shell: bash
-      run: build/reldebug/test/unittest --force-reload --force-storage
+      run: build/reldebug/test/unittest --force-reload --force-storage --summarize-failures
discussion_comments.comment_body: Thanks for this idea - now it should be able to get the flag from env too

discussion_comments.commented_code:
@@ -106,6 +106,9 @@ jobs:
   bundle-mingw-static-lib:
     name: Windows MingW static libs
     runs-on: windows-2019
+    env:
+      ENABLE_EXTENSION_AUTOLOADING: ${{ inputs.build_static_lib_mode }}
+      ENABLE_EXTENSION_AUTOINSTALL: ${{ inputs.build_static_lib_mode }}
discussion_comments.comment_body:
I think those do not achieve the goal here or at very least they are confusing, given build_static_lib_mode is not yet defined.

I would put those into actions/build_extensions, and there they can be dependent on `inputs.build_static_lib_mode` OR if you prefer to have them here just define them to be 1.

discussion_comments.commented_code:
@@ -106,6 +106,9 @@ jobs:
   bundle-mingw-static-lib:
     name: Windows MingW static libs
     runs-on: windows-2019
+    env:
+      ENABLE_EXTENSION_AUTOLOADING: ${{ inputs.build_static_lib_mode }}
+      ENABLE_EXTENSION_AUTOINSTALL: ${{ inputs.build_static_lib_mode }}
